namespace.title: resrouce.ui
namespace.description: Namespaces are identifiers for the UI files. They are used to access elements in some files across all other files. When adding a new namespace, it must have a unique name.

additionalProperties.title: resrouce.ui
additionalProperties.description: When referencing elements from different namespaces, it must have the following format: [element_name]@[namespace_reference].[element_name_reference]

type.description:
`label` - for creating text objects
`image` - for rendering images from a filepath provided
`button` - for creating interactive and clickable elements
`panel` - an empty container where you can store all other elements that may overlap to each other
`stack_panel` - an empty container where you can store all other elements in a stack that doesn't overlap to each other
`grid` - uses another element as a template, and then renders it repeatedly in multiple rows and columns
`factory` - renders an element based off of another element, is capable of calling hardcoded values and variables
`custom` - is paired with another property renderer which renders hardcoded JSON UI elements
`screen` - elements that are called by the game directly, usually root panel elements

visable.title: CONTROL
visable.description: If the UI element should be visible

enabled.title: CONTROL
enabled.description: If true and if the UI element or any of its children have the locked state then they will be in the locked

layer.title: CONTROL
layer.description: Z-Index/Layer (like zindex in CSS) relative to parent element. Higher layers will render above

alpha.title: CONTROL
alpha.description: Alpha/transparency of the element. It will only affect the UI element. Its children will be unaffected. If you want the alpha to apply for both the parent and children also use propagate_alpha

propagate_alpha.title: CONTROL
propagate_alpha.description: If alpha should not only apply to the parent if possible but also all its children

clips_children.title: CONTROL
clips_children.description: Cuts off visually and interactively everything beyond the bounderies of the UI element

allow_clipping.title: CONTROL
allow_clipping.description: If clips_children works in the UI element. Otherwise, it won't have any effect

clip_offset.title: CONTROL
clip_offset.description: Offset from the start of the clipping

property_bag.title: CONTROL
property_bag.description: Property bag contains properties/variables that are more related with the data than the actually structure and look of the UI element

selected.title: CONTROL
selected.description: If the text box is selected by default

use_child_anchors.title: CONTROL
use_child_anchors.description: Use the anchor_from andanchor_to of the child of the UI element

controls.title: CONTROL
controls.description: For adding children to the element

ignored.title: CONTROL
ignored.description: If the UI element should be ignored

variables.title: CONTROL
variables.description: A bunch of conditions that change the variables values

modifications.title: CONTROL
modifications.description: Allows to modify the UI files of resource packs below (vanilla being the most bottom one)

grid_position.title: CONTROL
grid_position.description: Position that the control will take inside the grid. This also allows to modify specific grid items of a hardcoded grid

collection_index.title: CONTROL
collection_index.description: Index that the control takes in the collection

size.title: LAYOUT
size.description:
Size of the UI element.
Possible values:
"default" (Default value which is "100%")
0 (Number of pixels)
"0px" (Number of pixels. It's the same as 0 but it's put inside a string with px at the end. It's used when you want to sum or subtract a percentage based value with a specific number of pixels. (e.g. "75% + 12px"))
"0%" (Percentage of relative to the parent element)
"0%c" (Percentage of the total width/height of the element children)
"0%cm" (Percentage of the width/height of the biggest visible child of that element)
"0%sm" (Percentage of the width/height of the sibling element)
"0%y" (Percentage of the element height)
"0%x" (Percentage of the element width)
"fill" (Expands to the remaining width/height of the parent element)

max_size.title: LAYOUT
max_size.description: Maximum size of the UI element can have

min_size.title: LAYOUT
min_size.description: Minimum size of the UI element can have

offset.title: LAYOUT
offset.description:
Position of the UI element relative to the parent UI element. It's TopLeft based meaning the coordinates [0, 0] start at the top left of the screen.
10- pixels
"10px" - pixels
"50%" - Width/height of the parent element
"50%x" - Width of the element
"50%y" - Height of the element

anchor_from.title: LAYOUT
anchor_from.description: Anchor point in the parent element.

inherit_max_sibling_width.title: LAYOUT
inherit_max_sibling_width.description: Use the maximum width of the sibling element

inherit_max_sibling_height.title: LAYOUT
inherit_max_sibling_height.description: Use the maximum height of the sibling element

binding_name.description: Stores the value of the data binding name or condition with it

binding_name_override.description: Name of the UI element property that will apply the stored value in binding_name

binding_collection_name.description: Name of the collection of items to be used

binding_condition.description: Condition for the data binding to happen.

source_control_name.description: Name of the UI element to observe its property values

source_property_name.description: Store the value of the property value of the UI element refered in source_control_name

target_property_name.description: The UI element property that the stored value in source_property_name will be applied to

orientation.title: STACK PANEL
orientation.description: Direction the elements stack inside stack_panel.

grid_dimensions.title: GRID
grid_dimensions.description: Number of columns and rows the grid has

maximum_grid_items.title: GRID
maximum_grid_items.description: Maximum number of items the grid will generate

grid_item_template.title: GRID
grid_item_template.description:
An element capable of handling collections
(e.g. "common.container_item", "container_items", "inventory_items" and etc.)

color.title: TEXT
color.description: Text color. RGB value from 0.0 to 1.0

locked_color.title: TEXT
locked_color.description: Text color when a parent has enabled: false

hide_hyphen.title: TEXT
hide_hyphen.description: Hide hyphen caused by word breaking

notify_on_ellipses.title: TEXT
notify_on_ellipses.description: Array of names of the controls to notify when text gets or loses ellipses

locked_alpha.title: TEXT
locked_alpha.description: Alpha/transparency of label when a parent has enabled: false

localize.title: TEXT
localize.description: If text should be able to be translated

backup_font_type.title: TEXT
backup_font_type.description: Font used if font_type didn't work

text_alignment.title: TEXT
text_alignment.description: Text alignment direction. If it's not defined it will adjust automatically based on anchor_from and anchor_to

texture.title: SPRITE
texture.description: Image path starting from pack root. (e.g. "textures/ui/White")

allow_debug_missing_texture.title: SPRITE
allow_debug_missing_texture.description: Display the missing_texture if the texture is not found

uv.title: SPRITE
uv.description: Start position of the texture mapping

nineslice_size.title: SPRITE
nineslice_size.description: 9-slice. A method that divides an texture into 9 pieces. When resized the corners will stay in place and the rest will stretch

tiled.title: SPRITE
tiled.description: If the texture will tile when the size of the UI element is bigger than the texture size.

clip_direction.title: SPRITE
clip_direction.description: Start point position for the clip_ratio. If down, the image will begin to appear from the bottom.

clip_ratio.title: SPRITE
clip_ratio.description: How much to clip. From 0.0 to 1.0

clip_pixelperfect.title: SPRITE
clip_pixelperfect.description: If the clip should try to be the most pixel accurate possible

bilinear.title: SPRITE
bilinear.description: Use the bilinear function when resizing the image

fill.title: SPRITE
fill.description: Scratch the image to the size

grayscale.title: SPRITE
grayscale.description: Render image in black and white

force_texture_reload.title: SPRITE
force_texture_reload.description: Reload image when the texture path is changed

from_button_id.description: ID of the action that fires the event

to_button_id.description: ID of the action to be executed when event is fired

focus_enabled.title: FOCUS
focus_enabled.description: If the arrow keys or controller can focus the element

focus_change_down.title: FOCUS
focus_change_down.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable element that will recieve focus when on button.menu_down. If you want to prevent the focus to escape from the bottom use FOCUS_OVERRIDE_STOP

focus_change_up.title: FOCUS
focus_change_up.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable element that will recieve focus when on button.menu_up. If you want to prevent the focus to escape from the top use FOCUS_OVERRIDE_STOP

focus_change_left.title: FOCUS
focus_change_left.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable element that will recieve focus when on button.menu_left. If you want to prevent the focus to escape from the left use FOCUS_OVERRIDE_STOP

focus_change_right.title: FOCUS
focus_change_right.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable element that will recieve focus when on button.menu_right. If you want to prevent the focus to escape from the right use FOCUS_OVERRIDE_STOP

other_focus_container_name.description: Name of the UI control that will receive focus when on button.menu_left, button.menu_right, button.menu_up or button.menu_down

focus_id_inside.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable child control of the other_focus_container_name that will recieve the focus

other_focus_container_name.description: Name of the UI control that will receive focus when on button.menu_left, button.menu_right, button.menu_up or button.menu_down

focus_id_inside.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable child control of the other_focus_container_name that will recieve the focus

other_focus_container_name.description: Name of the UI control that will receive focus when on button.menu_left, button.menu_right, button.menu_up or button.menu_down

focus_id_inside.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable child control of the other_focus_container_name that will recieve the focus

other_focus_container_name.description: Name of the UI control that will receive focus when on button.menu_left, button.menu_right, button.menu_up or button.menu_down

focus_id_inside.description: Identifier (focus_identifier) of the focusable child control of the other_focus_container_name that will recieve the focus

default_control.title: BUTTON, SLIDER BOX
default_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the default state

hover_control.title: BUTTON, SLIDER BOX
hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the hover state

pressed_control.title: BUTTON
pressed_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the pressed state

locked_control.title: BUTTON, SLIDER BOX
locked_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the locked state

toggle_name.title: TOGGLE
toggle_name.description: Identifier for the toggle group it belongs to. It can be a custom one.

toggle_group_forced_index.title: TOGGLE
toggle_group_forced_index.description: Index of the toggle in its group

toggle_group_default_selected.title: TOGGLE
toggle_group_default_selected.description: Index of the default toggle of the its group

toggle_grid_collection_name.title: TOGGLE
toggle_grid_collection_name.description: Name of the collection the toggle belongs to

checked_control.title: TOGGLE
checked_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the checked state

unchecked_control.title: TOGGLE
unchecked_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the unchecked state

checked_hover_control.title: TOGGLE
checked_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the checked hover state

unchecked_hover_control.title: TOGGLE
unchecked_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the unchecked hover state

checked_locked_control.title: TOGGLE
checked_locked_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the checked locked state

unchecked_locked_control.title: TOGGLE
unchecked_locked_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the unchecked locked state

checked_locked_hover_control.title: TOGGLE
checked_locked_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the checked locked hover state

unchecked_locked_hover_control.title: TOGGLE
unchecked_locked_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will be displayed only in the checked locked hover state

dropdown_content_control.title: DROPDOWN
dropdown_content_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the root content panel

dropdown_area.title: DROPDOWN
dropdown_area.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the inside content

sound_name.title: SOUND
sound_name.description: Name of the sound defined in the RP/sounds/sound_definitions.json file that plays when the pressed event is fired

sounds.title: SOUND
sounds.description: Array of the sounds to play when the pressed event is fired

sound_name.description: Name of the sound defined in the RP/sounds/sound_definitions.json file that plays when the pressed event is fired

min_seconds_between_plays.description: Seconds of wait before the sound can be played again

collection_name.title: COLLECTION
collection_name.description: Name of the collection to be used

text_edit_box_grid_collection_name.title: TEXT EDIT
text_edit_box_grid_collection_name.description: Name of the collection the edit_box belongs to

text_type.title: TEXT EDIT
text_type.description: Type of characters that the user is allowed to type in th text field.

max_length.title: TEXT EDIT
max_length.description: Maximum number of characters allow in the text field

text_control.title: TEXT EDIT
text_control.description: Name of the child control that will be used for displaying the text

place_holder_control.title: TEXT EDIT
place_holder_control.description: Name of the child control that will be used for display the placeholder text

slider_track_button.title: SLIDER
slider_track_button.description: ID of the action for the slider track

slider_small_decrease_button.title: SLIDER
slider_small_decrease_button.description: ID of the action for the decrease slider

slider_small_increase_button.title: SLIDER
slider_small_increase_button.description: ID of the action for the increase slider

slider_steps.title: SLIDER
slider_steps.description: How many steps (or values) does the slider have

slider_collection_name.title: SLIDER
slider_collection_name.description: Name of the collection the slider belongs to

slider_selected_button.title: SLIDER
slider_selected_button.description: ID of the action for when the slider is selected

slider_deselected_button.title: SLIDER
slider_deselected_button.description: ID of the action for when the slider is deselected

slider_box_control.title: SLIDER
slider_box_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the slider thumb

background_control.title: SLIDER
background_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the slider background

background_hover_control.title: SLIDER
background_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the slider background on hover

progress_control.title: SLIDER
progress_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the slider background overlay for the slider progress

progress_hover_control.title: SLIDER
progress_hover_control.description: Name of the child control that will behave as the slider background overlay for the slider progress on hover

scrollbar_track_button.title: SCROLL VIEW
scrollbar_track_button.description: ID of the action for the track button

scrollbar_touch_button.title: SCROLL VIEW
scrollbar_touch_button.description: ID of the action for the touch input

scrollbar_box.title: SCROLL VIEW
scrollbar_box.description: Name of child UI element or nested UI element that will behave as the scrollbar thumb.

scrollbar_track.title: SCROLL VIEW
scrollbar_track.description: Name of child UI element or nested UI element that will behave as the scrollbar track

scroll_view_port.title: SCROLL VIEW
scroll_view_port.description: Name of child UI element that will behave as the view port

scroll_content.title: SCROLL VIEW
scroll_content.description: Name of child UI element that will behave as the content root parent

scroll_box_and_track_panel.title: SCROLL VIEW
scroll_box_and_track_panel.description: Name of child UI element that will contain the scrollbox and track controls

jump_to_bottom_on_update.title: SCROLL VIEW
jump_to_bottom_on_update.description: Jump to the bottom when the scrolling panel has an update. For example, adds more children to it.

source_control_name.description: Name of the object to be evaluated

target_property_name.description: Property that its value will be override by the `source_property_name` value

binding_name_override.description: Property that its value will be override by the `binding_name` value

from_button_id.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel) Button (action) id that fires

to_button_id.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel) button (action) id that results

handle_select.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

handle_deselect.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

mapping_type.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

scope.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

input_mode_condition.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

button_up_right_of_first_refusal.description: Button mappings can be applied to any kind of input elements (button, toggle, slider and input_panel)

anim_type.description:
`alpha` - accepts float values, animates the opacity of the element
`offset` - accepts an array, animates the position of the element relative to its anchor
`size` - accepts an array, animates the size in ( width, height )
`flip_book` - accepts integer values, animates the image in flipbook texture or frame by frame
`uv` - accepts an array, animates the image depending on the UV texture
`color` - accepts float RGB values from 0.0 to 1.0, animates the color of the element
`wait` - accepts number values, used for waiting/staying purposes
`aseprite_flip_book` - like a flip_book animation, uses sprite sheets. More info here
`clip`

duration.description: Number. Duration of the animation in seconds

from.description: Number (`anim_type` alpha) or a size/offset array (`anim_type` size/offset)

to.description: (`anim_type` alpha) or a size/offset array (`anim_type` size/offset)

destroy_at_end.description: Name of the object to destroy (stop rendering/ignored) when the animation ends. Doesnt require namespace

next.description: Name of the animation that will play after this ends

play_event.description: Name of the event when the animation starts
